intro: Coniogramme nanchuanensis, commonly known as the Nanchuan coniogramme, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with distinctive lobed structures. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in umbels, and it produces red berries that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
